page.title: 17Schools.
page.content: {Hillesley C.E.V.A. School.}The school is over 100 years old, it originally catered for children up to 12 years, when they left school. It is now a primary school with about 32 pupils from 4+ to 11. There are 2 classes, one for infants and one for juniors. In July 1984 a new extension to the school was opened providing indoor toilets and an office/staffroom. The children move on to a comprehensive school at Wotton-under-Edge, at 11yrs. {Rose Hill School.}This is a private school catering for children from 4+ to 16 years, either boarders or day pupils.The school originated in Tunbridge Wells; moved to Banstead in Surrey; in 1939 the school moved to Alderley for the safety of the pupils, and there it stayed. The school is situated in the old manor house which was built in 1860.
